docs.text: Welcome to MkDocs For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs

docs.title: Project layout

docs.text: Understanding Logistic Regression Date: December 18, 2025 Classification is one of the most fundamental tasks in Machine Learning. Today I want to explore how Logistic Regression works under the hood. The Sigmoid Function Unlike Linear Regression which outputs continuous values, Logistic Regression transforms the output using the Sigmoid function: $$S(x) = \frac{1}{1 + e^{-x}}$$ Code Example Here is how I implemented it in Python: ```python import numpy as np def sigmoid(x): return 1 / (1 + np.exp(-x)) x = np.array([1, 2, 3]) print(sigmoid(x))
docs.title: Understanding Logistic Regression

docs.text: Date: December 18, 2025 Classification is one of the most fundamental tasks in Machine Learning. Today I want to explore how Logistic Regression works under the hood.
docs.title: Understanding Logistic Regression

docs.text: Unlike Linear Regression which outputs continuous values, Logistic Regression transforms the output using the Sigmoid function: $$S(x) = \frac{1}{1 + e^{-x}}$$
docs.title: The Sigmoid Function

docs.text: Here is how I implemented it in Python: ```python import numpy as np def sigmoid(x): return 1 / (1 + np.exp(-x)) x = np.array([1, 2, 3]) print(sigmoid(x))
